revised_title: Sex Determination and Gametogenesis in Neuroterus Lenticularis
tldr: The author conducted experiments to understand the difference between male-producing and female-producing females in the agamic generation of Neuroterus lenticularis. They found that the offspring of individual sexual females contained either all male-producing or all female-producing individuals, disproving the hypothesis that the difference depended on two kinds of spermatozoa. The author also confirmed that females of the sexual generation do not reproduce parthenogenetically.
